title: Sometimes even on HN, people call out bullshit!
comment:
The comment in the links is a response to [this one](https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=30559783) which is the usual «piracy gone too far» response, as above, to a submission about a browser extension that can bypass paywalls (and that's what it's transparently called). The reply is cool in that it points out how we **always** had some way of reading the all the news for free.

This is indeed a major problem with subscriptions and DRM'ed media, i.e. they are only accessible so long as you pay, and only to people those who pay. But we always have the papers and magazines in the waiting rooms, and we always had, even before the commoditised papers and books, the library.
